intro: Hieracium podomitum, commonly known as the Podomita hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from June to August. Hieracium podomitum is often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
